title: Public Records Request – Portland Parks Considered for Closure

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

To: Portland Parks, Recreation & Facilities Department
From: David Lide, Publisher, Maine Times
📧 david.lide@mainetimes.com
📰 news@mainetimes.com
📞 1-800-488-1820

Dear Records Officer,

Under the Maine Freedom of Access Act (1 M.R.S. § 401 et seq.), I respectfully submit this request on behalf of Maine Times, a privately held statewide news outlet focused on in-depth public-interest reporting and community accountability.

As part of an editorial series exploring access to public space and municipal infrastructure, Maine Times is requesting information about any Portland city parks or recreational facilities currently under internal review for closure, sale, or long-term service reductions.

Records Requested:
Please provide any lists, internal reports, memos, or summaries generated between January 1, 2022 and present that identify:

Parks or recreational facilities being considered for:

Closure, sale, repurposing, or permanent restricted access

Operational changes due to budget shortfalls, maintenance issues, or underutilization

If a formal list does not exist, we welcome any documentation reflecting internal discussions or evaluations.

About Maine Times
Maine Times is a privately owned statewide news organization, built with the long-term goal of becoming Maine’s leading source for credible journalism. While our flagship website is currently in development, Maine Times is actively producing original reporting through the Maine Times podcast and additional editorial channels.

We are building with purpose: to inform the public, amplify community voices, and hold institutions to account—across the entire state of Maine.

We respectfully request digital delivery of the requested records. If this request would result in any fees, please notify us in advance.

Thank you for your time and service.

Sincerely,
David Lide
Publisher – Maine Times
📧 david.lide@mainetimes.com
📰 news@mainetimes.com
📞 1-800-488-1820
🌐 Mainetimes.com

Have a story tip, know someone who should be featured, or interested in advertising? Reach out.
Maine Times is a privately held company based in Dover, Delaware, and proudly serves readers across the state.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Lide

title: DOGE Access to Treasury Systems and IRS Communications (Department of Treasury)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All internal communications, emails, memorandums, or policy documents from January 1, 2024 to present that reference:
1. The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)
Elon Musk, in his role as leader of DOGE
2. The extent or nature of DOGE’s access to Treasury systems, including but not limited to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, or any Treasury-managed financial systems
5. Any written agreements, memorandums of understanding (MOUs), access authorization forms, or audit trails/logs showing the scope, level, or duration of access granted to DOGE personnel or contractors.
4. Any risk assessments, internal reviews, or security evaluations performed in relation to DOGE’s access to Treasury data or systems.

I am not requesting individual taxpayer data or any protected personal information.

To assist with processing and reduce the burden, I am willing to accept:

1. Digital records only. 
2. Limited date range (January 1, 2024–present).
3. Redacted documents were legally necessary. 

I request a waiver of all fees in the public interest, as the release of this information is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kim Crooks

title: University of North Texas drag ban (University Of North Texas)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications received, sent, or created by or for Chancellor Michael Williams, President Harrison Keller, Regent Laura Wright, Steve Moore, or any person employed by the University of North Texas System Office of Government Relations, on or after January 20, 2025, which either:

(a) concerns drag performances, including the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10 and the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11; or 

(b) contains any of the following terms: "Executive Order", "gender ideology", "Queer Empowerment", "drag show", "drag shows", "drag performance", "drag performances", "drag night", "queer alliance", "YDSA", or "Young Democrats"; 

2. Any Title IX (or similar) complaint or report referencing the word "in drag", "drag performance", "drag show", "drag shows", or "drag performances". This request is limited to complaints filed on or after January 1, 2020.

3. Any records held by administrators or staff of the University of North Texas concerning the planning, logistics, or approval of (a) the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10; or (b) the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11.

4. If the University of North Texas maintains a reservation system or database for event reservations, all entries (and records contained in the system) concerning (a) the GLAD Queer Alliance UNT Drag Show 2025 scheduled for April 10; or (b) the UNT Gammas Drag Night with the Gammas scheduled for April 11.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: CPRA Request for Bodycam, Dashcam, and Aerial Footage – March 26, 2025 Arrest in Simi Valley

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request for Bodycam, Dashcam, and Aerial Footage – March 26, 2025 Arrest in Simi Valley
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of the following records related to the March 26, 2025 high-speed pursuit of three organized retail theft suspects, which ended in Simi Valley near the 2500 block of Woodhaven Court:

All body-worn camera footage from Ventura County Sheriff’s deputies involved in the pursuit and arrest.

All patrol vehicle dashcam footage related to the pursuit and foot chase.

Any aerial footage (e.g., helicopter or drone) captured during the incident, including from Sky5 or any law enforcement aircraft.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: DOGE–CFPB Communications Regarding Agency Restructuring and Enforcement (Jan–Present)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOGE–CFPB Communications Regarding Agency Restructuring and Enforcement (Jan–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act, I request access to all communications (including emails, memos, or written directives) from January 1, 2025 to present between any representative of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and CFPB leadership (including the Acting Director and Chief Operating Officer). Please note that a federal judge has ruled DOGE is subject to FOIA (CREW v. DOGE, March 10, 2025), and has ordered expedited processing and full document preservation. This request falls squarely within the scope of that ruling.

Please include any documents that discuss:

Agency restructuring

Staff reductions, layoffs, or reassignments

Budget changes

Suspension or freezing of enforcement activities

I am a private citizen requesting this information for personal, non-commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andy Dufresne

title: Public Records Request – Dashcam and Bodycam Footage – July 19, 2023 Arrest of Dylan Lemma

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Dashcam and Bodycam Footage – July 19, 2023 Arrest of Dylan Lemma
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to the following public records related to the July 19, 2023 incident and arrest of Dylan Lemma, the 19-year-old son of Sheriff Dennis Lemma:

Dash camera footage from the deputy who attempted the traffic stop around 8:00 a.m. near East Lake Drive and Celestial Way, involving a Ford Mustang and a white Nissan, both allegedly racing.

Any available body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the attempted stop, identification, or follow-up investigation.

According to public reports and agency statements, Dylan Lemma fled at high speed in a Ford Mustang after a Seminole County deputy attempted a traffic stop, and later turned himself in to the John E. Polk Correctional Facility on charges of fleeing and reckless driving. The incident has drawn public interest due to the relationship between the suspect and the head of the agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to public records related to the January 15, 2025 arrest of Southwest Airlines pilot David Allsop, age 52, at Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport, including:

All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the investigation, detainment, and arrest of Mr. Allsop on DUI charges at the airport, beginning from initial contact near or before 7:00 a.m.

Surveillance or security footage from the airport (if available and not exempt), particularly any camera angles showing the pilot’s interaction with security, gate agents, or passengers.

Mr. Allsop was reportedly preparing to operate Southwest Flight 3772 to Chicago and was arrested before takeoff for allegedly showing visible signs of intoxication. The incident resulted in significant flight delays and raised public interest about aviation safety and pilot screening.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the arrest of Lisa Marie Kroeger-Kangas, age 46, of Claremont, on or about Tuesday, July 11, 2023, by the New Hampshire State Police:

All body-worn camera footage from troopers involved in the traffic stop, arrest, and subsequent events on Interstate 93 northbound in Concord, beginning at approximately 11:30 p.m.

All dash camera footage from the State Police cruiser(s) involved in the stop and transport.

Any footage capturing the moment when Ms. Kroeger-Kangas allegedly kicked out the rear passenger-side window of a cruiser while detained, sending glass toward two troopers on scene. Any rear-seat footage of the suspect being transported.

According to public statements, Ms. Kroeger-Kangas was arrested for aggravated DUI, and additional charges—including resisting arrest, disorderly conduct, reckless operation, and criminal mischief—were added after the cruiser window was damaged.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

title: Black (African) Book Publishers, Distributors, Stores, Authors and/or Titles

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Black (African) Book Publishers, Distributors, Stores, Authors and/or Titles
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 1968, J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI (All Field Offices) launched a COINTELPRO Operation against black independent bookstores (booksellers), associations, distributors, publishers, authors, titles, etc. It was modeled after similar operations since the 1920s against independent, radical, leftist, socialist, communist, and other bookstores (booksellers), associations, distributors, publishers, authors, titles, etc.

Each FBI Office and Sub-Office was required to (1) identify bookstores in their territory, and (2) open investigations on each to determine if it was extremist in nature,” (3) the identities of the owners; (4) whether it is a front for any group or foreign interest; (5) whether individuals affiliated with the store engage in extremist activities; (5) the number, type, and source of books and material on sale; (5) the store’s financial condition; (6) its clientele; and (7) whether it is used as a headquarters or meeting place.”

We are especially interested about books by and about Kwame Nkrumah and Panaf Books (Press), Sekou Toure, Malcolm X, Marcus Garvey, Mao Tse Tung

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ROBERT BROWN

title: Open Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage of Senator Regina Goodwin Traffic Stop (January 11, 2025)

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage of Senator Regina Goodwin Traffic Stop (January 11, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act (51 O.S. § 24A.1 et seq.), I am requesting access to the following public records:

All unedited body-worn camera footage from Tulsa County Sheriff's Office deputies involved in the traffic stop, detainment, and citation of Oklahoma State Senator Regina Goodwin on January 11, 2025, near the 200 block of E. Archer Street in Tulsa.

Dashcam footage from the officer who pulled the suspect over.

This request includes footage from the initial stop, all verbal exchanges between Senator Goodwin and the deputy, the moment she was placed in handcuffs, and any interactions with members of the public who approached during the stop. I request the original, unedited video as maintained by the Sheriff's Office, not a media-edited version.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Public Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage from November 2, 2024 (EverBank Stadium Incidents)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Unedited Body-Worn Camera Footage from November 2, 2024 (EverBank Stadium Incidents)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

am requesting access to the following public records:

- All unedited body-worn camera footage recorded by JSO Deputies Officer ED Kelly, Officer DJ Bowers, Officer J Anthony, Officer JS Beasley, and Officer A Catino during two incidents involving fan altercations at the Florida-Georgia college football game at EverBank Stadium on November 2, 2024.

Specifically:
1. Footage involving the suspect accused of trespassing and attempting to disarm Officer Kelly, including the use of racial slurs and threats.
2. Footage involving the three individuals who refused to leave the stadium stands, escalated into a confrontation with officers, and were arrested with use of force and tasers.

Please include full footage from each involved officer, beginning at first contact with the individuals through the conclusion of the detainment or arrest, prior to any public redaction or media editing.

Preferred format: digital download or secure link via email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Charles Newsome Murder Evidence

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Charles Newsome Murder Evidence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All evidence in relations to the case of Kendrick D. Gillum, Antonio Williams, and Demarco Wilson’s murder of Charles Newsome (hereinafter "the case of Charles Newsome's murder").
2. All records cataloging the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome's murder, and identifying the location(s) of the evidence at the time of such cataloging.
3. All records, if any, referencing the “loss” of any of the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder.
4. All records, if any, referencing the “misplacement” of any of the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder.
5. All records, if any, referencing to the signing out of any of the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder, and any returning of evidence that had been signed out.
6. All records identifying any policies or procedures to be followed by the WMPD in preserving evidence seized in criminal cases.
7. All records evidencing any communications by one or more of the West Memphis Police Department police officers or any other members of the WMPD and any third-parties concerning the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder from February 1, 1997 to date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Marc Howard.

communications.subject: RE: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Charles Newsome Murder Evidence
communications.communication: This was a West Memphis case and we are not in possession of the records that you are requesting.

title: Police Rosters + Photos (Long Beach Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

The roster of sworn police officers from 2016 - 2024
Names, badge numbers, serial numbers, division/station, sworn status.

 The department's headshot photos of all of the same officers are referenced above. Duplicates from each year do not need to be completed. At a minimum, photos for 2023 - 2024 should be included. 

Precedent: Santa Ana Police Department and LAPD have released their photos. A reminder that nothing in California Penal Code 832.7 mentions photographs in personnel records are kept confidential. Not only that, but videos and pictures of officers are regularly shared on social media. 
https://www.courthousenews.com/judge-tosses-las-second-lawsuit-against-journalist-over-police-headshots/
https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2024-11-13/city-of-la-officers-city

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: FOIA Request - Fayette County Opioid Settlement Funds

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request - Fayette County Opioid Settlement Funds
communications.communication:
Ruth Lanier, County Administrator 
Fayette County Commission
100 N Court Street 
Fayetteville, WV 25840

Dear Ruth Lanier, 

Pursuant to the state open records law W.Va. Code Secs. 29B-1-1 to 29B-1-7, I write to request access to public records regarding Fayette County’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting copies of: 
the amount of funds Fayette County has received so far
the application to apply for funding
the individuals who will review the funding applications
the process by which funds will be awarded
documents or other information detailing how the opioid settlement funds distributed to Fayette County have been awarded through March 1, 2025, if at all, including budgets, grant allocations, and expenditure reports.
any existing or proposed plans outlining future use of said opioid settlement funds, including strategic plans, meeting minutes in which county-level officials participated, and correspondence and attachments regarding funding allocations.
any public reports, audits, or documentation created by the county regarding the accountability and impact of these funds
All attachments, addendums, appendices, exhibits, and other related documents that were included as part of the contracts.

If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address.
As provided by the open records law, I will expect your response within five (5) working days. See W. Va. Code Sec. 29B-1-3(d).
If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.
I would note that willful violation of the open records law is a misdemeanor, punishable by a fine of not less than $200 nor more than $1,000, or imprisonment in the county jail for twenty (20) days, or both. See W. Va. Code Sec. 29B-1-6. Court costs and attorney fees may also be awarded. See Sec. 29B-1-7.
Thank you for your assistance.
Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,
Aidan Cornue
(312) 458-5125
amc00069@mix.wvu.edu

title: FRS Reports (George Mason University)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024. Specifically:

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook.
